page.title: 02The River Afan
page.content: Today's Afan is a far cry from the coal-ridden,effluent outlet of 1951. This is largely due to the efforts of the Afan Valley Angling Club assisted by the Welsh Water Aurhority. Despite the difficulties which emanated from coal,iron, and sewage pollution, a series of five-year plans have given the Afan a new potential which has since been realised. The river is being devloped as a migratory fishery and at the same time caters for the needs of the trout angler. The construction of a fish pass and readjustment or gradients have opened the river up to migratory salmonids to enter the whole of the Afan system, thus offering high expectations for the future.
